monster.name: Avalanche Giant

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The gaint makes two slam attacks or two iceberg attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, range 10 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (1d12+7) bludgeoning damage and 4 (1d6) cold damage. Creatures that are medium or smaller that are hit with this attack must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

action.name: Iceberg
action.text: Ranged weapon attack: +11 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d6+7) bludgeoning damage and the target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target becomes restrained. On a success, the target's movement speed is reduced by 10 ft. This effect last until the start of the target's next turn.

action.name: Charge
action.text: The avalanche giant moves in a straight line up to 60 ft. moving through the space of any enemies that are large or smaller, or stopping when it hits any impassable terrain. Any creature whose space was moved through must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 21 (3d8+7) bludgeoning damage and is pushed in the same direction 20 ft. past where the avalanche giant ended its movement. If a creature pushed in this way would collide with a stationary object, it takes an additional 13 (3d8) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Ice Barrier
action.text: The avalanche giant casts wall of ice at 6th level with a DC 15 spell saving throw.

monster.description:
The living embodiment of a mountainside's wrath, these titanic beings stride with the force of landslides, burying intruders beneath boulders and sheets of crushing frost. Territorial and near-mindless, they are living disasters driven by ancient instincts to protect the high peaks from the touch of civilization.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Legends of Norse Mythology p. 14 (Third Party)

monster.name: Draugr
monster.languages: understands all languages it spoke in life but can't speak

trait.name: Stench
trait.text: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 ft. of the draugr must succeed on a DC 9 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned until the start of its next turn. On a success, the creature is immune to the draugr's stench for 24 hours.

trait.name: Corpselike
trait.text: While motionless, the draugr is indistinguishable from a normal corpse.

trait.name: Resurrecting
trait.text: If the corpse of a draugr is not dealt radiant or fire damage, it will return to life with full hit points at the next sundown.

action.name: Spear
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6+2) piercing damage and 3 (1d4) cold damage.

action.name: Evil Eye
action.text: The draugr states with its evil eye at a creature it can see within 60 ft. The creature must succeed on a DC 9 Charisma saving throw or take 3 (1d4) necrotic damage and have disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the end of its next turn.

monster.description:
Guarding the wealth of cairns and royal tombs, draugr are reanimated corpses. Their frostbitten and weathered skin is inured to the cold.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Legends of Norse Mythology p. 16 (Third Party)

monster.name: Lava Giant

trait.name: Fumarole Cloak
trait.text: Creatures that enter or begin their turn within 10 ft. of the lava giant must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or take 7 (2d6) poison damage and 7 (2d6) fire damage. Creatures farther than 30 ft. from the lava giant have disadvantage on ranged attack rolls against it.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The giant uses its battleaxe attack and then its rock attack.

action.name: Battleaxe
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d6+6) slashing damage plus 4 (1d6) fire damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be pushed back 30 ft. The lava giant may choose to ignore this secondary effect.

action.name: Rock
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d6+6) bludgeoning damage. All creatures within 5 ft. of the target, including the target, must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or take 14 (4d6) fire damage. This effect occurs even if the original attack misses.

action.name: Lava Stomp
action.text: The giant stomps the ground. All creatures within 30 ft. must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or take 21 (6d6) fire damage. The ground affected by this attack remains molten for 3 rounds, becoming difficult terrain and dealing 7 (2d6) fire damage to all creatures for each 5 ft. of movement they make across the molten ground. A 5 ft. square of heated ground can be cooled prematurely by dealing at least 1 cold damage or by using a gallon of water.

monster.description:
Lava giants are mighty, flame-wreathed warriors born in the hearts of volcanoes and forged by the wrath of forgotten fire gods. The skin is red-hot, and every strike of their runed axes spits great globs of molten rock. They guard the sacred volcanic forges of the old world, testing all who trespass with trials of fire and fury.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Legends of Norse Mythology p. 17 (Third Party)

monster.name: Grendel
monster.immune: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks, fire, cold

trait.name: Sensitive Hearing
trait.text: Whenever the grendel takes thunder damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of the next round.

trait.name: Nocturnal Stealth
trait.text: While in darkness, the grendel is invisible. While in dim light, the grendel has +10 bonus to Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
trait.text: If the grendel has advantage on an attack roll, it adds 2d6 to the damage of that attack.

trait.name: Stalker
trait.text: The grendel has +10 bonus to Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track and follow prey.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The grendel makes three attacks: two with its claws and one with its bite.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8+5) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8+5) piercing damage. If the target is a beast or humanoid, the grendel regains a number of hit points equal to the damage dealt.

action.name: Raging Throw
action.text: One creature within 5 ft. must make a DC 17 Strength saving throw. On a failure, the creature is thrown 40 ft. and takes 23 (4d8+5) bludgeoning damage. If the creature collides with another target within range, that target must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 23 (4d8+5) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
action.text: Each creature of the grendel's choice within 60 ft. that is aware of it must succeed ona. DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of the grendel for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once the effect ends for a creature, it is immune to the grendel's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Snuff Flame (Bonus Action)
action.text: The grendel extinguishes a single source of fire within 20 ft. no larger than a 5 ft. cube.

action.name: Gorge (Bonus Action)
action.text: The grendel consumes a corpse and regain 18 (4d8) hit points.

monster.description:
A grendel is a monstrous, solitary predator born from cursed bloodlines and ancient vengeance, lurking at the edges of civilization where wild darkness endures. Towering and sinewy, with mottled flesh like wet stone and claws that rend armor like cloth, it emerges only to slaughter, drawn by joyless hunger and the sound of revelry. Shunned by even other monsters, grendels are the bane of. halls and hearths.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Legends of Norse Mythology p. 18 (Third Party)

monster.name: Huldra

trait.name: Forest Dweller
trait.text: The huldra has advantage on any Intelligence (History), Intelligence (Nature), or Wisdom (Survival) checks made about the forest they inhabit.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts
trait.text: The huldra can communicate with beasts as if they shared a language.

trait.name: Underbrush Walker
trait.text: Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track the huldra have disadvantage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4+3) slashing damage.

action.name: Irresistible Dance
action.text: The huldra can cast irresistible dance with a spell save DC of 13.

action.name: Charming
action.text: Target creature that can see the huldra must make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or become charmed for 1 minute. The creature may repeat this save at the end of each of its turns, or whenever they take damage.

monster.description:
Huldra are hauntingly beautiful forest wardens with bark-lined hearts and hollowed wooden spines, cloaked to conceal the truth of their nature. born of old primal magic and shaped by human longing, they offer aid and shelter to those who respect the wild places.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Legends of Norse Mythology p. 20 (Third Party)

monster.name: Lindworm
monster.languages: Draconic, understands Common and Giant but can't speak

trait.name: Old-Blood Resilience
trait.text: The lindworm has advantage on saving throws against poison, and magic can't put it to sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The lindworm makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10+4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage, and the target must then make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or become paralyzed until the end of the lindworm's next turn.

action.name: Tail Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13(2d8+4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

action.name: Venomous Spray
action.text: The lindworm sprays its blinding venom in a 15 ft. cone. All creatures within the cone must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature 14 (4d6) poison damage and is blinded for one minute. At the end of each blinded creatures' turn, it can repeat this saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a success, the creature takes half as much poison damage and isn't blinded.

monster.description:
Lindworms are ancient, serpentine dragons. Lacking wings and hind limbs, they slither through deep caverns and shadowy forests, speaking curses in forgotten tongues and coiling around old cairns and barrows. They strike with venomous fury when disturbed.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Legends of Norse Mythology p. 21 (Third Party)

monster.name: Mountain Troll

trait.name: Stony Skin
trait.text: If the troll would take 10 or less damage from an attack, it instead takes no damage.

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
trait.text: The troll takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks. Additionally, if the troll drops to 0 hit points while in sunlight, it become petrified and cannot regenerate.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Hatred of Divine
trait.text: The trolls deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage to any creature that casts divine spells (clerics, paladins, druids, etc) or is under the effect of a divine spell or ability (such as bless, divine smite, channel divinity, etc).

trait.name: Divine Sense
trait.text: The troll can sense the presence of divine magic within 30 feet, as if it always had detect evil and good active, but it only registers celestial, cleric/paladin spellcasters, and ongoing divine magic.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The troll makes three attacks: two with its claws and one with its bite.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6+5) piercing damage.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, rach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10+5) piercing damage.

action.name: Alchemical Grabbag
action.text:
The troll reaches into its bag and pulls a potion. Roll a d4 to determine which potion was pulled and then use the potion.
Alchemical Grabbag: d4 | Potion 1 | Bitter Cure 2 | Stink Bomb 3 | Sticking Mud 4 | Rocks in a Bottle

action.name: Bitter Cure
action.text: The troll takes 4 (1d6) poison damage and then it may make an additional saving throw against an effect of their choice. The troll then heals 7 (2d6).

action.name: Stink Bomb
action.text: A stinking cloud forms at a point within 40 ft. All creatures must succeed on a DC 14 Constituion saving throw or take 5 (1d8) poison damage and become poisoned for 1d6 rounds.

action.name: Sticking Mud
action.text: One creature within 40 ft. of the troll must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving trhrow, or have their AC reduced by 2 for 1 minute. This effect does not stack.

action.name: Rocks in a Bottle
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 40/80 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description:
Smarter than their common brethren, mountain trolls have a semblance of society, and some are even willing to trade, especially for goods found above ground - as they turn to stone if they enter sunlight. In exchange, they are willing to part with the strange potions they create. These creatures are known to wear simple clothing and have an intense hatred for the divine.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Legends of Norse Mythology p. 22 (Third Party)

monster.name: Norn
monster.immune: necrotic, psychic, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Magical Resistance
trait.text: The norn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Timeless
trait.text: A norn is immune to effects that would alter its age, perception of time, or ability to act in combat (such as time stop or slow). It can also not be surprised.

trait.name: Norn Coven
trait.text:
Norns are known to work as a trio in a coven. A coven is made up of three norns all of whom are equals within the group. One focuses on the past, another on the present, and the final one on the future. While all three members of a norn coven are within 30 ft. of one another, they gain the following benefits:
• What Was. If a spell is used by a norm, and the target succeeds on their saving throw and is unaffected, the norn recovers the lost spell slot.
• What is. The norns are immune to critical hits. Additionally attacks rolls made with their shears critically hit on a 19-20.
• What Will Be. The duration of cut thread and weave thread increases to 2d4 rounds.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
The norn is an 18th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). The norn can cast disguise self at will.
• Cantrips (at will): Guidance, Resistance, Spare the Dying, Sacred Flame • 1st level (4 slots): Bane, Bless, Command, Inflict Wound • 2nd level (3 slots): Aid, Augury, Locate Object • 3rd level (3 slots): Clairvoyance, Bestow Curse, Dispel Magic • 4th level (3 slots): Banishment, Divination, Locate Creature • 5th level (3 slots): Geas, Legend Lore, Scrying • 6th level (1 slots): Harm • 7th level (1 slots): Divine Word • 8th level (1 slots): Control Weather • 9th level (1 slots): Gate

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The norn makes three attacks with its shears.

action.name: Shears
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17(4d6+3) slashing damage plus 9 (2d8) force damage. If the target is below half its hit points maximum, it must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Cut Thread
action.text: The norn targets one creature it can see within 30 feet. The creature must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target drops to 0 hit points. On a success, it takes 33 (6d10) force damage. This ability has no effect on creatures immune to being frightened.

reaction.name: Bend Fate
reaction.text: Once per round, after a d20 is rolled, but before the effect takes place, the norn may choose to force that d20 to be re-rolled. The original roll is entirely discarded, substituted by the secondary roll.

monster.spells: Disguise Self, Guidance, Resistance, Spare the Dying, Sacred Flame, Bane, Bless, Command, Inflict Wound, Aid, Augury, Locate Object, Clairvoyance, Bestow Curse, Dispel Magic, Banishment, Divination, Locate Creature, Geas, Legend Lore, Scrying, Harm, Divine Word, Control Weather, Gate
monster.description:
Few know the whims of a norn. These creatures who bend fate to their will are just as likely to aid someone as fight them. Prophecies are the only things norns cherish. They often take the form of women at various ages. Those lucky, or unlucky, enough to see them state there is an otherworldliness to the way they look and act that is hard to describe.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Legends of Norse Mythology p. 24 (Third Party)

monster.name: Tatzelwurm

trait.name: Coiled Pounce
trait.text: If the tatzelwurm moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, the target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. The tatzelwurm can then make one bite attack against the target as a bonus action

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The tatzelwurm makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6+3) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or take 5 (2d4) poison damage and be poisoned until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Damage: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4+2) slashing damage.

action.name: Poisonous Breath
action.text: All creatures in a 15 ft. cone must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. A poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

monster.description:
These cat-faced wurms are known for their headache-inducing breath and pervasive shrieks when on the prowl. Much like the proud and playful hall cat with which they share a face, tatzelwurms can form relationships with other creatures who provide shelter, protection, or conveniently misplaced pieces of meat.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Legends of Norse Mythology p. 26 (Third Party)
monster.environment: urban, forest, hill, grassland, desert, swamp

monster.name: Valkyrie
monster.resist: lightning, poison, radiant, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Inspiring Leader
trait.text: Allied creatures within 20 ft. of the valkyrie gain a bonus to their saving throws equal to the valkyurie's Charisma modifier.

trait.name: Radiant Armament
trait.text: Any weapon held by the valkyrie becomes a +1 magic weapon that deals an extra 9 (2d8) radiant damage on a hit.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The valkyrie makes two spear attacks.

action.name: Spear
action.text: Melee weapon attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d10+6) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) radiant damage.

action.name: Brilliant Landing
action.text: The valkyrie flies up to 60 ft. landing in an unoccupied space. All creatures within 20 ft. must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 23 (4d8+5) radiant damage and becoming blinded for 2 rounds on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Pour Mead (Bonus Action)
action.text: The valkyrie feeds an adjacent creature mead from its mead horn. The target regains 14 (3d8) hit points, and is cured of all exhaustion, curses, diseases, and poisons.

action.name: Shield the Worthy (Bonus Action)
action.text: The valkyrie chooses one creature within 30 feet that she can see. That creature gains resistance to all damage until the start of the valkyrie's next turn.

monster.description:
Clad in chainmail and wielding a spear, these celestial warriors are as much protectors of the living as they are protectors of the dead. They shine brilliantly with radiant light, blinding their foes. These divine beings are known to enter battlefields to ferry the slain to the great beyond. Wherever war rages, valkyries aren't far behind.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Legends of Norse Mythology p. 27 (Third Party)

monster.name: Viking Berserker

trait.name: Reckless Attack
trait.text: If the berserker misses its attack, it may re-roll the attack roll once, however attack rolls against the viking have advantage until the beginning of its next turn.

trait.name: Die Hard
trait.text: The first time the berserker would fall to 0 hit points, it falls to 1 hit points instead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The berserker makes two handaxe attacks.

action.name: Handaxe
action.text: Melee or ranged weapon attack: + 5 to hit, reach 5 ft., or range 20/60 ft. Hit: 7 (1d6+3) slashing damage.

action.name: Raging Flurry
action.text: The berserker may make a melee handaxe attack against a creature within range. If the attack hits the berserker may choose a different creature within range and make a melee handaxe attack against that creature. The berserker may continue to make these attacks until either: an attack misses, or all creatures within range have been attacked and damaged by this berserker. A creature that was hit by this berserker cannot be targeted by this attack again this round.

action.name: Rage (Bonus Action)
action.text: As a bonus action, the berserker can enter a rage, becoming resistant to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage, and gaining +2 damage to all attacks. The rage lasts for 1 minute, however, it ends early if the berserker is knocked unconscious, or if its turn ends and it hasn't attacked a hostile creature, or taken damage since its last turn.

monster.description:
First into the battle, berserkers swing with wild abandon. Often without armor and wielding nothing but small axes, these Vikings may seem ill prepared and yet are often the only warriors left standing. The mayhem of blood and violence is so intoxicating to the berserker that they may not even realize they are being wounded.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Legends of Norse Mythology p. 28 (Third Party)

monster.name: Viking Skald

action.name: Spear
action.text: Melee weapon attack: +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8+2) piercing damage.

action.name: Sling
action.text: Ranged weapon attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft. Hit: 5 (1d4+2) slashing damage.

action.name: Warcry
action.text: One allied creature may use its reaction to make a single weapon attack.

action.name: Healing Verse (Bonus Action)
action.text: One creature of the skald's choice within 30 ft. regains 7 (2d6) hit points.

action.name: Heroic Edda (Bonus Action)
action.text: All allies within 20 ft. reroll 1's and 2's on damage die until the beginning of the skald's next turn.

monster.description:
The bards of viking culture recite heroic poems, even on the battlefield. Warriors are inspired by their words and surge into battle alongside them. They sing and chant in between strikes of their weapons, predicting the mighty blows of their allies.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Legends of Norse Mythology p. 29 (Third Party)

monster.name: Viking Jarl

trait.name: Die Hard
trait.text: When the jarl is reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, it can drop to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Grit
trait.text: Whenever the Jarl fails a saving throw it may re-roll the save, however it subtracts 1d4 from the new saving throw. The Jarl must take the second roll.

trait.name: Heroic Leadership
trait.text: When the Jarl or a creature targeted by the Jarl's Command defeats an enemy, all allies within 60 ft. gain 1d4 temporary hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Jarl makes two greataxe attacks and two longbow attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d12+4) slashing damage. On a critical hit, the target must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 150/600 ft. Hit: 7 (1d8+2) piercing damage.

action.name: Command (Bonus Action)
action.text: One allied creature that can hear the Jarl and has a CR or level below 8 may make a single weapon attack with advantage against a creature of the Jarl's choice within range of the attack.

action.name: March Order (Bonus Action)
action.text: Up to 8 creatures of the Jarl's choice within 60 ft. may immediately move up to 30 ft.

action.name: Brace Order (Bonus Action)
action.text: Up to 8 creatures of the Jarl's choice within 60 ft. may choose to have their speed reduced to 0 and gain +3 to their AC until the beginning of the Jarl's next turn.

monster.description:
The survivor of hundreds of battles, the Jarl is the leader of Viking villages. With age comes wisdom and the ability to lead, along with the grit and determination to survive in such a harsh environment.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Legends of Norse Mythology p. 30 (Third Party)

monster.name: World Serpent
monster.languages: understands Draconic and Celestial, but doesn't speak
monster.immune: cold, poison, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, poisoned, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the World Serpent fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Eater of Worlds
trait.text: The World Serpent can breathe underwater, walk on water, and is immune to extreme cold, pressure and vacuum. It suffers no ill effects from being in deep ocean or planar space.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The World Serpent has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Thick Scales
trait.text: Whenever the World Serpent would take damage, it takes 10 less damage.

trait.name: Titanic Coil
trait.text: The World Serpent occupies a 30-foot-by-30-foot space and can coil into confined areas without squeezing. It ignores difficult terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The World Serpent uses its Frightful Presence and then makes four attacks, one with its bite, two with its thrashes, and one with its tail, or it uses three actions that require a recharge.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 43 (5d12+10) piercing damage plus 22 (5d8) poison damage. A large or smaller creature reduced to 0 hit points by this attack is swallowed by the World Serpent. While swallowed, the creature is unconscious and has total cover from effects outside the Serpent. At the start of each of the Serpent's turns, the swallowed creature takes 42 (12d6) acid damage from its digestive fluids. If the creature takes damage equal to or exceeding its hit point maximum while swallowed, its body is dissolved and cannot be revived by anything short of a true resurrection, wish, or similarly-powerful magic. If the World Serpent takes 50 or more damage in a single turn from a creature inside it, it must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of it.

action.name: Thresh
action.text: All creatures within 15 feet of the world serpent must succeed on a DC 24 Dexterity saving throw or take 23 (2d12+10) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 27 (3d10+10) bludgeoning damage. Creatures damaged by this attack must succeed on a DC 24 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

action.name: Frightful Presence
action.text: Each creature of the World Serpent's choice within 120 ft. of it must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the World Serpent is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the World Serpent's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Breaking Earth
action.text: The ground shudders and separates creating a deep fissure. All creatures in a 60 ft. line originating from the World Serpent must succeed on a DC 24 Dexterity saving throw or fall 20 ft. into the fissure, taking 9 (2d8) bludgeoning damage. Any creatures still in the fissure at the beginning of the World Serpent's next turn take 36 (8d8) bludgeoning damage and must succeed on a DC 24 Strength saving throw or become buried alive and begin suffocating. Creatures buried under rubble may free themselves as an action with a successful DC 22 Strength (Athletics) check.

action.name: Crashing Skies
action.text: The sky thunders. All creatures within 120 ft. of the World Serpent must make a DC 24 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) lightning damage on a failure or half as much on a success. Additionally, all airborne creatures within 500 ft. of the World Serpent must succeed on a DC 24 Strength saving throw or immediately fall 500 ft., taking the appropriate fall damage if they hit the ground.

action.name: Boiling Seas
action.text: The waters roil. All creatures within 120 ft. of the World Serpent must succeed on aa DC 24 Wisdom saving throw or take 33 (6d10) fire damage and make a second DC 24 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, all liquids on their person, including potions, boil and disappear. Any creatures submerged in water has disadvantage on these saving throws.

action.name: Shattering Reality
action.text: The barrier between worlds breaks. All creatures within 60 ft. of the World Serpent must succeed on a DC 24 Intelligence saving throw or ascend 100 ft. floating weightless in the air., Any creature that failed this saving throw must make a second DC 24 Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, all magic items with charges in their posession lose one charge, and if they have any spell slots, they lose a spell slot of their choice. The weightlessness effect ends at the beginning of the World Serpent's next turn.

action.name: Doomsday
action.text:
Doomsday begins without a charge and a recharge action must be suceeded to use this action. All creatures within 120 ft. of the World Serpent must make a DC 24 Charisma saving throw. ON a failure, they take 13 (2d12) necrotic damage and 13 (2d12) radiant damage, and the creature's hit point maximum is reduced by this amount until greater restoration is cast on them. All creatures that failed this saving throw must make another DC 24 Charisma saving throw. On a failure, they are affliced with the Doomsady Curse.
Doomsday Curse - Bearers of this curse have -2 to all attack rolls, saving throws and ability checks. Multiple applications of this curse are cumulative.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: The dragon can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The dragon regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Bite
legendary.text: The World Serpent makes a single bite attack.

legendary.name: Move
legendary.text: The world serpent moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Spray Poison (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: All creatures in a 90 ft. cone originating from the World Serpent must succeed on a DC 24 Constitution saving throw or take 26 (4d12) poison damage.

monster.description:
The World Serpent is a gargantuan, ancient monstrosity said to encircle the edges of the mortal world, its breath poisoning the sea and its coils shaking the earth. It speaks no language, yet its presence alone heralds omens, madness and the slow unravelling of order. Worshipped, feared or hunted by the gods, the World Serpent is all inevitability given ultimate form.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Legends of Norse Mythology p. 32 (Third Party)
